Our duty in this historic moment was clear.

My colleagues and I did not seek office to impeach anyone, but today we were forced to do so by a lawless president who will stop at nothing to hold onto power.

Our oaths require us to defend the Constitution, and that is what we did.

Though they won’t say so publicly, my Republican colleagues know in their hearts that the President’s acts are deeply wrong.

They know they would not tolerate a Democratic President who sought foreign interference in our elections, abused power, and brazenly obstructed Congress.

President Trump is the third President to be impeached by the House of Representatives, but his abuses of power and obstruction of Congress are the worst ever committed by an American President.

His high crimes and misdemeanors are ongoing.

The facts are clear, and uncontested.

President Trump is impeached by the  House of Representatives pursuant to our powers under Article I of the United States Constitution.

The articles we passed impeach President Trump for abuse of power and obstruction of Congress.

I voted YES on both articles of impeachment.
The United States House of Representatives has impeached President Donald John Trump.

Nunes' words here are especially bad but they are also representative.

Republican leaders have argued all day that abuse of power, which formed an article of impeachment against Richard Nixon, is basically fine and certainly not an impeachable violation of the Constitution. https://twitter.com/fordm/status/1207447634904002560 …

Last year Trump sent us a broken, unworkable draft of USMCA.

House Democrats led by @SpeakerPelosi & @RepRichardNeal went to work to rebuild it with stronger provisions on enforcement, environment, labor, and prescription drug prices.

Today I supported the deal they fixed. https://twitter.com/politico/status/1207053833182089216 …

The bill also fully funds the 2020 census, invests in election security, and gives civilian federal employees a 3.1% raise next year. And we avoid another disastrous shutdown. 

It's not perfect but we got important victories for Northern Virginia families that will really help.

I'm so happy this patient-focused legislation will become law with other vital healthcare priorities, including investments in NIH medical research, grants to prevent suicide and fight the opioid epidemic, and the first CDC funding for gun violence prevention research in decades!

Good news: my effort to reauthorize and fund @PCORI, begun earlier this year when I introduced the PATIENT Act, just passed in the House funding bill!

PCORI is a research agency which helps patients get the evidence-based information they need to make good healthcare decisions.

Today @WaysMeansCmte approved @RepRonKind @RepDavid's bipartisan resolution, which I cosponsored, to support the World Trade Organization. US businesses, workers, and consumers need reforms to make sure international trade is fair, and we must reassert American leadership there.
